summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons memorandum from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, dated August 10, 2019. It reports that inmate Jeffrey Epstein was found to have attempted suicide, was transported to a hospital, and was pronounced dead at 7:36 AM due to cardiac arrest. The memorandum instructs staff not to speak to the media.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who attempted suicide and was pronounced dead at the hospital on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Lieutenantej
persons.context: The author of the memorandum who was instructed to report to the hospital, received the news of Epstein's death, and directed staff not to speak to the media.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's Death
events.description: Inmate Jeffrey Epstein attempted suicide, was transported to NY Downtown hospital via EMS, and was pronounced dead at 7:36 AM due to cardiac arrest.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein died on the morning of August 10, 2019, at approximately 7:36 AM.
The official cause of death reported in this memorandum is cardiac arrest following a suicide attempt.
The incident occurred while Epstein was an inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
BOP staff were instructed not to speak to anyone, including the media, about the situation and to direct inquiries to the MCC Public Relations Officer.
